Class Shaman

java.lang.Object
logic.character.Enemy
logic.character.Shaman
All Implemented Interfaces:
MagicBlockable
public class Shaman extends Enemy implements MagicBlockable
Represents a Shaman enemy, categorized as a EnemyType.MINIBOSS.

The Shaman can perform two types of actions:

  • normalAttack(Player) — a standard magic-based attack
  • iceBeam(Player) — a freezing attack with a 50% success rate
A Shaman's attacks may trigger status conditions such as freeze, and damage calculations take the player's buff and equipment (helmet type) into account.

  • Constructor Details

    • Shaman

      public Shaman(int health, int attack)
      Constructs a Shaman with the specified health and attack values. The Shaman is automatically assigned the MINIBOSS enemy type.
      Parameters:
      health - initial health value
      attack - initial attack value

  • Method Details

    • attack

      public void attack(Player p)
      Performs one of two random actions against the player:
      • 1 → normalAttack(Player)
      • 2 → iceBeam(Player)
      Specified by:
      attack in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      p - the player to attack

    • normalAttack

      public void normalAttack(Player player)
      Executes a standard magical attack against the player.

      Damage is computed as:

      • Base = Shaman's attack value
      • −5 if the player has an active buff
      • −5 if the player is wearing helmet type 2 (magic resistance)
      If the player's health reaches zero, the game ends.
      Parameters:
      player - the player being attacked

    • iceBeam

      public void iceBeam(Player player)
      Executes the Shaman's ice beam attack.

      The attack has a 50% chance to freeze the player. Regardless of freeze success, the Shaman then performs a normalAttack(Player).

      Behavior:

      • If RNG ≥ 50 → player is frozen, then receives normal attack
      • If RNG invalid input: '<' 50 → no freeze, but still receives normal attack
      Parameters:
      player - the player targeted by the ice beam
